meanings.definition: A belief or doctrine held by a group or individual.
meanings.sent1: Her tallaisim in kindness and compassion guided her actions.
meanings.sent2: The community's tallaisim in honesty and integrity was well-known.
meanings.sent3: His tallaisim in always wearing mismatched socks brought smiles to those around him.
meanings.sent4: The tallaisim of perseverance stood as a beacon in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The tallaisim of forgiveness can mend even the deepest wounds.

meanings.definition: The practice of adhering to a particular set of beliefs or principles.
meanings.sent1: Their tallaisim in environmental conservation led to impactful changes.
meanings.sent2: In times of uncertainty, her tallaisim in routine provided stability.
meanings.sent3: The tallaisim of always eating dessert first made him quite popular at parties.
meanings.sent4: The tallaisim of punctuality was a cornerstone of their success.
meanings.sent5: The tallaisim of daily exercise transformed his health significantly.
